column4: et al: I believe ?dm refers to the display manager you're using. Ubuntu will most likely be using gdm, Kubuntu using Kdm. Xdm is also a possibility
actually, no; unless you've got more than one installed, typing "?dm" verbatim will do the right one, since ? is a wildcard in bash.
i know because i made that factoid ;)
I know, but sometimes one needs to elaborate :)
